herbs.description: A tangy herbal drink made from dried hibiscus petals, known for its refreshing taste and potential health benefits including blood pressure regulation.
herbs.preparation: Boil dried petals in water for 10-15 minutes, strain and serve hot or cold
herbs.precautions: Avoid during pregnancy, may interact with blood pressure medications

herbs.description: Mu Oko Le is a revered traditional Nigerian herbal tonic specifically formulated for male virility, increased testosterone production, and enhanced sexual performance. This ancient blend combines powerful aphrodisiac herbs that have been used for generations in Nigerian traditional medicine to support male reproductive health, boost energy levels, and improve overall vitality. The formulation includes carefully selected herbs known for their testosterone-boosting properties, libido enhancement, and male fertility support. Mu Oko Le represents the wisdom of traditional healers who understood the complex interplay between herbs and male hormonal balance, offering a natural approach to male wellness that has stood the test of time.
herbs.preparation: Traditional preparation involves steeping 1-2 tablespoons of the Mu Oko Le blend in 2 cups of hot water for 15-20 minutes. The mixture is then strained and consumed warm. For enhanced potency, some traditional practitioners recommend adding honey or palm wine to the preparation. The tonic is typically taken in the morning or early evening for optimal results.
herbs.dosage: 1 cup daily, preferably in the morning or early evening. For intensive use, 2 cups daily (morning and evening) for up to 30 days, followed by a 7-day break.
herbs.precautions: Consult with a healthcare provider before use, especially if you have heart conditions, high blood pressure, or are taking medications. Not recommended for pregnant or breastfeeding women. May interact with blood pressure medications, diabetes medications, and antidepressants. Discontinue use if experiencing adverse effects such as rapid heartbeat, dizziness, or severe headaches.
herbs.honey_usage: Traditional Mu Oko Le preparations often include raw honey for its natural sweetness and additional health benefits. Honey is believed to enhance the tonic's effectiveness and provide natural energy boost. Some formulations also include palm wine or other traditional sweeteners for enhanced potency.
